intro: Radicula nuttallii, commonly known as the Nuttall's radicle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Radicula nuttallii is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
